cellularAutomata.error
Class ErrorHandler

java.lang.Object
  cellularAutomata.error.ErrorHandler

public class ErrorHandler
extends java.lang.Object

A collection of methods for handling errors that happen while the CA is running. Typically notifies the user and then ends the program.

Author:
David Bahr

Constructor Detail

ErrorHandler

public ErrorHandler()
Method Detail

endProgramNicely

public static void endProgramNicely(java.lang.Throwable error)
Ends the program "nicely" for users that may not want details of the error. First says there has been a fatal error and then asks if the user would like more details about the error (before ending the program).

However, if the user is debugging (CAConstants.DEBUG = true), then the error is just rethrown and the program is not ended.

Parameters:
error - The fatal error that is making the application close.

endProgramNicely

public static void endProgramNicely(java.lang.String detailMessage,
                                    java.lang.String title)
Ends the program "nicely" for users that may not want details of the error. First says there has been a fatal error and then asks if the user would like more details about the error (before ending the program).

Parameters:
detailMessage - A message detailing the error so the user will know why the program is ending. This message is only made visible at the request of the user.
title - The title of the JOptionPane warning message.

endProgramWithWarning

public static void endProgramWithWarning(java.lang.String warningMessage,
                                         java.lang.String title)
Ends the program after warning the user.

Parameters:
warningMessage - A warning message to the user telling them why the program will end.
title - The title of the JOptionPane warning message.

endProgramWithWarningUnlessDebugging

public static void endProgramWithWarningUnlessDebugging(java.lang.Throwable t,
                                                        java.lang.String warningMessage,
                                                        java.lang.String title)
Warns the user of an error, and then ends the program unless the user is debugging (CAConstants.DEBUG = true), in which case the program continues.

Parameters:
t - The error that caused the program to quit. If the user is debugging then this is rethrown.
warningMessage - A warning message to the user telling them why the program will end.
title - The title of the JOptionPane warning message.

stopSimulationWithWarning

public static void stopSimulationWithWarning(java.lang.String warningMessage,
                                             java.lang.String title)
Stops the simulation after warning the user, but does not end the program. Note that it may take some time for the simulation to end because it will not stop until all cells in a generation have been updated.

Parameters:
warningMessage - A warning message to the user telling them why the simulation will be stopped.
title - The title of the JOptionPane warning message.
